alert.note: Alert for Carroll (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 31 at 9:04PM CST until January 02 at 12:00AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO MIDNIGHT CST SATURDAY NIGHT... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, with locally higher amounts possible south of I-80. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of east central and southeast Iowa and northwest Illinois. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 6 AM Saturday to midnight CST Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 for Iowa, or by visiting 511ia.org, modot.org, or idot.Illinois.gov.
